intro: Knautia arvensis proles timeroyi, commonly known as the Timeroys knautia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as schizocarps, which disperse its seeds via the wind. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
